snippet: On the verge of its first default on Wednesday, the troubled agency faces a cash shortfall that could reach $1.2 billion by next year, documents show.
abstract: Postal Service documents show the troubled agency, on verge of its first default due to future benefits payments, faces a cash shortage of $100 million; shortage stems from declining mail volume that could balloon to $1.2 billion in 2012.
lead_paragraph: On the verge of its first default on Wednesday, the troubled agency faces a cash shortfall that could reach $1.2 billion by next year, documents show.

headline.seo: Postal Service Default May Be Followed by Deeper Woes
headline.main: As Default Looms, Postal Service Sees Deeper Woes
headline.print_headline: As Default Looms, Postal Service Sees Deeper Woes
